intro: Rosa carolina var. alba, commonly known as the white Carolina rose, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring thorny stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces fragrant, white flowers with five petals, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This variety is valued for its ornamental beauty and historical significance in American horticulture.
